TrainingElement.Title: Image
TrainingElement.BodyCopy:
Images will be commonly used within the BYU-I site. The Image element allows users to import images from the assets folder.

How to upload Images

   In order to upload an image to the assets folder click on the  Assets  button located in the CMS tool bar. All departments should have a predefined image folder to place images in. If you are not sure where to upload images to, please refer to upper management or technical support.

Interface

Image:

   The Image field is where the user can type the file address of the image file the wish to use.

   If needed, the Browse button can be used to display the contents of the assets image folder where a user can select an image. Doing so will insert the file address of the selected image.

Width and Height

   The Width and Height fields only display the selected image's width and height. Changing the width and height within these fields does not change the size of the image.

Unused Fields

  • Alt Text:
  • Alignment

How to Edit a Selected Image (Image Editor)

   If a correct file address has been entered in the image field, the image will be displayed within the image field. Double clicking this image will bring up the Image Editor.

Image Editor Interface

   Basic imaging tools are available for user changes, but remember after making changes to accept or reject your changes.

These buttons will be provided.

Saving

  • Save Changes - Save changes to current image file
  • Save As - Save to new image file
  • Close - Disregard all changes and close editor
